intro: Nasturtium obtusulum, commonly known as the bluntleaf nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Tropaeolaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant orange or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often used in ornamental gardens and can also be edible, though they are less commonly consumed than other nasturtium varieties. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to naturalize in suitable environments.
